org.tsugi

Interface Database

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseDatabase

    public interface Database
    This is a set of database convienence methods This is a reimplementation of the PDOX library in the PHP Tsugi but it might not be the best solution since the JDBC PreparedStatement is more elegant and may not benefit from this layer. So hold off using these wrappers for a bit.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Properties> allRowsDie(String sql, List<String> arr)
      Prepare and execute an SQL query and retrieve all the rows as an array While this might seem like a bad idea, the coding style for Tsugi is to make every query a paged query with a limited number of records to be retrieved to in most cases, it is quite reasonable to retrieve 10-30 rows into an array.

      • getLaunch

        Launch getLaunch()
        Get the launch associated with this object

      • selectDie

        ResultSet selectDie(String sql,
                    List<String> arr)
        Prepare and execute a SELECT query or die() in the attempt.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        \ResultSet This is the ResultSet from the query or or the error is logged and a RuntimeException is thrown.

      • selectReturnError

        ResultSet selectReturnError(String sql,
                            List<String> arr)
                     throws SQLException
        Prepare and execute a SELECT query and return the error
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        \ResultSet This is either the real ResultSet from the query call or an SQLErrror is thrown.
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • insertDie

        Long insertDie(String sql,
               List<String> arr)
        Prepare and execute an INSERT primary key query and return the new primary key.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        Long This is the new primary key of the inserted row if the insert was successful. If anything goes wrong the errors are logged and a runtime exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        Long This is the new primary key of the inserted row if the insert was successful.
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • updateDie

        int updateDie(String sql,
              List<String> arr)
        Prepare and execute an UPDATE, DELETE or INSERT without a primary key
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        int The number of rows affected (may be zero) If anything goes wrong the errors are logged and a runtime exception is thrown.

      • rowDie

        Properties rowDie(String sql,
                  List<String> arr)
        Prepare and execute an SQL query and retrieve a single row.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        Returns:
        Properties This is either the row that was returned or null if no row was returned. If anything goes wrong the errors are logged and a runtime exception is thrown.

      • allRowsDie

        List<Properties> allRowsDie(String sql,
                            List<String> arr)
        Prepare and execute an SQL query and retrieve all the rows as an array While this might seem like a bad idea, the coding style for Tsugi is to make every query a paged query with a limited number of records to be retrieved to in most cases, it is quite reasonable to retrieve 10-30 rows into an array. If code wants to stream the results of a query, they should do their own query and loop through the rows in their own code.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to execute in a string. If the SQL is badly formed this function will die.
        arr - An optional array of the substitition values if needed by the query
        error_log - Indicates whether or not errors are to be logged. Default is TRUE.
        Returns:
        List This is either the rows that was returned or null if no rows were returned. If anything goes wrong the errors are logged and a runtime exception is thrown.
